results.title: Notes on a harpsichord
results.creator_credit: David Cheshire, John Read and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Craftsman”.
Follows a harpsichord from its construction to a concert performance. Philip Ledger, who is Musical Director of the Aldeburgh Festival and is one of Britain’s finest continuo players, describes the basic features of the harpsichord, and introduces the man who maintains and tunes his own harpsichord for concert performance - Malcolm Russell.

results.title: Northern Ireland
results.brief_description: A summary of the agriculture and industries of Northern Ireland. Following an introductory map, we see farm scenes and typical farming activities; hay making and harvesting oats and potatoes, harvesting and treatment of flax, digging peat for fuel; dairying and fishing. The film ends with the industries of Belfast, linen mills and ship building, and the export from Belfast of the products of Northern Ireland.

results.title: North of 60 east
results.creator_credit: E.L. Burnell, T.R. Wagstaff, Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: On patrol with the Royal Canadian Mounted Police of the eastern Canadian Arctic, north of the 60th parallel. This film shows the day-to-day routine of constables who police the vast area that includes Baffin and Ellesmere Islands. For those who might choose northern service, the film provides clear impressions of the requirements of this detachment; for the general audience it gives an interesting overall view of the people, life and environment in the eastern Arctic.

results.title: No toothache for Eskimos
results.brief_description: A 5-minute version of “Let’s keep our teeth” suitable for young children (8-11 years of age) which shows the tough primitive diet of the Eskimos. Children are attracted by the food sequences which, linked with points about the reasons for tooth decay, make a quick transition from amusement to instruction. Vividly portrays life in the Arctic.

results.title: No other way
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World Is Ours”.
The history of the International Labor Organization since World War I. Illustrates two main aspects of its work: the improvement of labor conditions (exemplified by the Maritime labor conventions) and the improvement of living standards. Points out that poverty anwhere is a threat to prosperity everywhere. Shows activities in Libya, where the ILO has helped train workers for new UN assisted industries. Narrated by James McKechnie.

results.title: No other choice
results.creator_credit: Krishna Singh and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Impressions of the value and necessity of international cooperation, showing how more advanced countries can help in health, education and economic development of backward and depressed parts of the world. It is argued that cooperation in constructive work and toleration of differences in pursuit of common welfare are the best ways to resolve conflict of national interests. Narrated by Alexander Scourby

results.title: Duke of Wellington
results.creator_credit: Frank Stevens, Clifford Parris and Film House Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “London No 1”.
A visit to Apsley House at Hyde Park Corner in London which belonged to the first Duke of Wellington and houses the Wellington Museum. It is known popularly as No. 1, London.

results.title: Nitrous oxide, oxygen, ether, anaesthesia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
This film shows the working of a typical apparatus designed to deliver a continuous flow on nitrous oxide to the patient. Ether in varied quantities can be added to the mixture of gases as required. One animated diagram sequence in the film deals with the way in which the machine works; another deals with the principle of re-breathing. Induction and maintenance of anaesthesia are demonstrated with emphasis rather on the use of the machine than on general principles.

results.title: Nikkolina
results.creator_credit: Glen Salzman, Rebecca Yates, Cineflics and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Deals with the conflict of one’s own personal goals and one’s family by presenting a story about an American-born girl in a Greek immigrant family, and her resolution of the conflict between a skating event and a family wedding.
